data.text: The eBay app is a good alternative to the desktop/laptop version, in a few ways. For one, there are notifications and special coupons for using it. Also, the essential categories and settings in the site are prioritized for mobile devices. Also, there is less RAM used than a desktop/laptop, which helps maintain the bare minimum for an online application.

I don't think I've had a bad experience with buying on ebay. I only wish i used this site for all my sales. Other than that, even with returns for something that came wrong, different than pictures, broken, or I changed my mind, I've never had an issue with any seller. Nor needed ebay's help to back me up on a return. Sellers have all been great, happy buyer, soon to be seller.

This app is HOT GARBAGE for sellers. No back button is one of the biggest issues. Purchasing the label fails to process like 50% of the time. The app so basic, there are a ton of features I didn't even know were an option (on the desktop site.) ALSO.... PLEASE put "Sold" on the main filters page, it takes so long for it to load and scroll etc. Every single seller will thank you.

Great app: needs improvements. 1. There seems to be a bug with item listing from saved sellers store's which are out of stock showing up as if they were not yet sold out. 2. I think more customization options added to seller profile pages such as status message separate to that of the seller's bio. It's gets annoying over time a when trying to track specific items from saved sellers stores, there's limited native options for, third party websites pick up where eBay saved searches lacks.

Love eBay!! If you want something that is usually expensive, check eBay before buying it, cuz 99% of the time it's there & it's cheaper! Things are available Brand New, Open Box, Used or bid on an item it's up to you. Who doesn't like to save money?!? I know I do! I also sell items on there & you can too, it's pretty easy. You can just scan the bar code & everything about it pops up, or u can enter the info. You can even see what the going rate is! I'm telling you, check out eBay it's worth it.

Absolutely awful no matter what I do gift card, debit, credit, PayPal, etc. They will not accept any money at all. I've contacted them and they totally brushed me off, told me to wait 24 hours and ended the conversation. Now they say it's my bank contacted the bank nope they say that ebay is ending the transaction and issuing a refund. DO NOT AUCTION ON THIS SITE. once upon a time it was good but not anymore!

It is a quick link to check in on any auction/offers I am trying to keep track of. The only complaint I have with ebay is that the search algorithm is not always accurate. (ie if I search for lowest price first, it doesn't always show all the lowest price items first, so I have to go through the whole list anyway. This is not a function of the app itself though. Otherwise, I LOVE ebay.

I use the eBay app for buying & selling. As a buyer, it's a user friendly app. Easy to search, narrow down the results, swipe for more pictures of the item (zoom in etc). As a seller I love the app. I've never had any issues posting new items for sale from my phone. Easy to upload pictures, item details, see when an item has sold, even print my shipping labels from the app! I've been selling on eBay for over 20 yrs and love that I can do it 'on the go' with this app.

I have had good and bad experiences! More good than bad! Bought a few items in the past from individuals and they sent tracking info, well when they said it was delivered and I go see, not here! Go to the post office and they say that they didn't have so called package and then when I inquire about it you tell me that it's delivered and the case is closed! Lost a bit of money that way and I don't like it!!!

The latest update SUCKS!! The new look is HORRIBLE!! The "navigation task bar" at the bottom of the screen is an eyesore, and when on the Notifications screen, the bottom of the screen (the last item in the list) gets covered by the navigation task bar! The Message list "grouped conversation" is TERRIBLE!! And now there's no option to switch back!! WTH!! What's the point of sorting feedback by "Most Relevant"?! The app was much better to use BEFORE this latest update!!! I give it ZERO stars!👎👎

You finally made it better after a lot of years and this past update you change the description section to a small pop up box? I'm done figuring you guys out. You're strange people. Stop changing things just for fun. Having the whole item page was good. Zooming out bc it defaulted to zoomed in was stupid but that doesn't mean we want slow, small and lack of detail. You only cost the co money.

Horrible. Uninstalling. Recent updates to "improve user experience" has done the opposite! So many changes has made this app very difficult to use. Options that we once had are now gone. There are so many that 500 characters aren't enough to accurately describe them all. Save yourself the headaches & your phone the valuable space & just use the website itself instead. I Do not recommend this app AT ALL. 👎👎👎

Excellent app that does pretty much everything you'd need from eBay. I can do everything from take pics and create a listing for anything I want to sell. And it is even easier since you can create one by scanning it's UPC or taking a pic of it and seeing what similar items have sold. Auctions and communicating with sellers are even easier on a phone. I have no complaints besides "autopayment" for offers and auctions. That's a terrible decision by eBay. You can't use gift cards either!

I've been buying on here since 2016. I swear by EBAY, its the legit only app I use to shop for everything online, from game systems to car parts, flat screen TVS, everything on here is very affordable, you can find great items, New, good condition, or even pre-owned for way better prices than stores, Amazon, or any other online or in person store. The app is set up perfectly for you to be able to find the things you want, validate and check the sellers, and be able to buy, bid, and trade. A+++++

I like the app it's simple but could definitely use some tweaking. Having some advice from sellers who use the app every single day like myself may have you a few ideas of how to better fit it to be more streamlined. But love eBay as a whole. PS would love if you guys could update things so you can see the custom SKU when you click on an item. Customers will message and ask questions about an item and I'll have to go to revise the listing on order to see the SKU. Makes things take longer.

What the hell is going on with eBay lately? Every update seems to break something else. Now I have trouble adding things to my cart. it makes it real interesting buying things when you can't put items in your cart. I could do Buy It Now, but that means a separate transaction for every single item I want to purchase. Up until about two months ago, this app worked flawlessly. Another star lost. Only two left before I dump the app altogether and start shopping elsewhere.

As a seller, it is the worst. I've never had problems with this app until the last few months. It's updated and I restart my phone each time an app or the phone updates and I have notifications turned on but I receive NO notifications. And I recently received 'negative feedback' as a result of this. A sale was made but I had no awareness of it and a month went by before I realized it as I had to check it manually. And after reaching out to customer service multiple times, it still isn't fixed

Ok. How do you delete saved searches. Why screw with things that work fine? Well I leave a review and my watched item disappears and ends because I can't find it COINCIDENCE? Used to be great. Like when I was in purchases and clicked my ebay I could go to watched items. Who's bright idea to make where you have to click home then start all over to open up watched items or saved items

I have used eBay for a few years now purchasing a wide variety of items both new and used. All but one was a great experience, Items exactly as described and quick shipping. only one was a scam and the item was shipped all around the world for about six weeks, according to the tracking, but in the end ebay made right with a refund without hesitation. Thank you ebay

Sends spam constantly with offers for items that I viewed but didn't like/watch, and this feature can't be turned off. No one wants this feature!!! If I'm interested in an item, I will add it to my watch list. It's so stupid because due these spam offers, I had to turn all notifications off, so now I also won't see offers for items that are actually on my watch list. People have been complaining about this feature for years, just end it already.

Not one to review apps, but as a seller, this new update is horrible. Why does eBay continue to make it more difficult for sellers when, in the end, it affects the customer? There's now a glitch when uploading pictures where you can't rearrange them anymore. Also, you can no longer upload pictures in a specific order either. The search is completely broken. When searching for "Red shirt size medium," you now get all different sizes and colors in search.... Why? This is horrible for the customer.

For the most part the employees and sellers have always been awesome. I love the fact you can set US sellers only just because our bank blocks foreign transactions anyway so it saves the hassle. One suggestion would be to add customize search results like the desktop version has. There's quite a few customizable options the app is still lacking.

The recent update is horrible. Adding a permanent menu to the side creates an off putting and clunky experience. It adds no additional functionality, nor does it speed up anything. Simply put, this update makes the UI look amatuerish and unfinished. In fact, it reduces the users ablility to view items with a smaller view, on an already smaller screen. Altogether poor experience causing me to strictly use ebay in my browser with webview. At least give us the option to close the obnoxious menu.

data.userName: Bro. Matthew Levis O. de M.
data.text: As for ads being clear as to what the product actually is, well sometimes the picture of the product is deceptive and the product looks larger than it actually is. This is not helpful when looking at a product that you specifically searched for. Also, when I search for a certain size of a product it gives me everything but that size. What good is searching specifically when you don't keep to that search? Thank you.

Update - still sucks. Now, after you click on a post and add it to your cart, when you go back to your feed it gives you a notice that it streamlined your choices. Meaning you start over from the beginning of your feed. You can opt out but guess what? You're still at the beginning of your feed. Too frustrating to use. Try mercari or Poshmark.
data.replyText: Thanks for the review and sorry the app is causing some troubles. we would like more details so we can look into this. Could you please post to https://www.ebay.com/android so we can get in touch with you directly.

data.text: I have been using ebay for 20+ years. 2 issues I have: something will get lost in the mail, your money is gone, the item is gone, and eBay doesn't help go after the postal folks who are obvious stealing. Also, It's a nightmare to sell anything anymore. Ebay marks things discounted without ever even contacting the seller. I had to quit selling. I would list something for 20 bucks and free shipping. And then I would look and it would sell for 7 dollars. They also obviously do not filter scammers

Works well. Easy to find items. Easy to find and status purchases. Connects to feedback. Connects to messages. Easily bids. Connects well with PayPal. It makes it very quick to traverse through whatever I want to accomplish. Very useful for me. I'm sure there are improvements. There always are. But for what I do it works perfectly. What else can I say?

I have a couple of issues with this: 1. If you try to delete your recently viewed items, it will still remember them and suggest them to you again in the future, which I find highly irritating. 2. Ebay has started offering AI descriptions for listings, which is nothing but an absolutely useless load of pixels and tells us exactly ZERO about the actual item. What buyers want to know is stuff like the actual condition of that specific item, which AI can't provide.

Used to be stable. The last few days it started 'forgetting' my purchase list, showing me half of my items or even things from ages ago. Loads slow... searches create endless loops with the same items showing again and again and again. Look at item and go back to search and poof parameters are gone. Offers list: crashfest. Ebay: hire developers in a country where there is actual skill not just cost cutting. And make customer service tel connection easier instead of hiding behind stupid bots!

Not about to sell on Ebay anymore, as it's not like it was 10 years ago. Fees are through the roof, and most of my listing never even get viewed, despite being thoroughly detailed in title and description. Their algorithm makes it practically pointless. It suggests a price as if it actually knows what I'm selling. I'm not wasting the time to list vintage items I know are worth more just to get some chump change. Going to go with Mercari or some other site for selling in the future.

The app is definitely better than the online version especially when it came to managing the shipping and all of that that I couldn't do via online. Super easy to use with lots of features at your fingertips and is nice to interact on with customers. I've noticed that the shipping is pretty good especially when I mail items to customers. I always use it especially to check on everything and I highly recommend it when it comes to shopping for whatever your looking for

Love using this app, BUT they don't listen to their sellers. Constantly losing sales because Ebay forces "make offer"on items priced to sell, customers send offers, get refused and walk away. Everyone wants profit, if I factor in a good price, I don't expect to get undercut by Ebay, who won't budge on its percentage and fees. Also adding a USPS priority box option took almost a week just to list 1 item. And if you offer a discount on items you can't also offer combined shipping . Great.

App used to be great. Now, when you do a search, random things pop up that are unrelated to the searched subject. It seems the devs have given up on the app. If the app tells you that it has condensed the searched, it's a lot of good deals so that the sponsored sales are pushed. There are a high number of scam posts on ebay now, too. It's definitely not worth the time and energy to search anymore. I will forever miss the old eBay in which the devs put effort into.

I am a buyer on eBay and I have had mostly good experiences. I recently had an item not arrive. It wasn't the sellers fault or eBay, but after some time they eventually compensated me for the lost package. Although I didn't think it would happen, I was very pleased that despite not receiving the item I had purchased at least I did not incur a financial loss as well. I was able to use the app to maintain contact with the seller and eBay. I also use the app to track my bidding and my purchases.

EBay is quick to make things right if they go wrong. Listing items is pretty straightforward it takes a while. they could use another way to fill out the information quicker like a talk to text AI interface to put stuff in the right places for you that would be extremely beneficial. Also if was a designated way to send & receive notifications for sales and questions even if it was another app for notifications that's linked with sales. A lot of little fees for a lot of things can add up quickly.

Was working well for me for a while. It wanted me to "try" the new messaging system, so I "tried" it. Now, it won't let me get back to the classic messaging. New messaging does not let me access my file folders, or move items to my file folders. Learned the hard way, don't believe when they tell you "try", because you can't go back! 😤

As a small seller, ebays increase in fees, including taking a percentage of shipping costs, which are already less than what shipping actually costs, is getting excessive. I just spent 16 dollars to ship 3 items. Ebay charged my buyers approximately 11.40 between the 3 of them (supposedly the actual cost) and then charged me a percentage of that in fees, so i lost over 10 bucks on shipping alone.

Straight forward app but very spammy notifications. Notifications regarding "Items I'm interested in" include items you may have just glanced at. That means if you were looking for a specific part and stumbled upon similar or unrelated parts along the way, you will get notifications about the latter. There needs to be an explicit option for watchlist items. Or only just have the "interested in" category only include watchlist items.

Very informative although selling at a competitive rate feels like entering a lottary maybe the seller pics you maybe not so many items the same yet prices all over the board. For no specified reasons .you can intentionally drop prices lower than the others but then it must seem as if something's wrong with product go to high or basing correct price on sold item prices can put your listing price so much higher than the others I find listed can create a life long wait for item to sell...

Many things which I've wanted or needed have been available on this app, including some things I enjoyed earlier in life that I wished I could find again ! There are processes and tools in place to help if there's a misunderstanding or problem, and though I have had to get an issue or two sorted, eBay has always been solid in the process. (I can't say same for some merchants selling supposedly antique bronzes, or the "wool" pullover woods parkas!) I really enjoy having eBay as a resource!

eBay is back to automatically changing your buy it now listings to accept offers even if you turned it off. Filled the app with more ads and now less functional. More ads and less search results. Sends me messages every 2 or 3 days telling me to once again verify my information that I've verified a hundred times and to change my listings to offer 1 day handling and 90 day returns. It's ridiculous. No way to block these stupid messages either.

I've used eBay since 2006. They strive to keep sales honest and are great mediators to ensure a smooth transaction. Update: eBay just keeps getting better. The live auction feature is genius. It does have a few hiccups that need to be worked on, such as the coin doesn't show where the bidding is at dollar wise, this morning it was showing a coin already sold on the banner on bottom. They'll fix it. I still give it 5 🤩 stars

New update to app for uploading photos is awful. Ebay added too many steps to what was before a seamless process. I can only upload 1 photo at a time vs all at once. 3 dot drop downs are useless when we could just tap the photo anywhere. You cannot move photos around if need from the initial upload you have to click done then go back in to do so. You can no longer tap the photo to bring it up you have to hit the drop down then view it. This makes it harder to refer back to photo for item specifi

It's EBay. You find random stuff on it, but on a mobile app rather than a website, but less functions. I use the app for notifications rather than respond emails and mobile layouts keep rolling out smoothly. my big reason for giving one star is it keeps taking one step forward then two steps back. The big issue is steadily increasing fees and slowly decreasing customer service. If God forbid someone makes an issue as a buyer or seller, it is near impossible to navigate to a solution on app

I remember a time when you could type in what you wanted to search for, and this app would show you ONLY what you asked for, and a time when you could "watch" certain items and get reminders for those items. Now this app sends me alters for items I looked at one time and decidedI didn't want, and the search function shows me "things you might like" INSTEAD of the things I searched for. Between the incessant alerts and the uncontrollable search function, it's become nothing but unusable noise!

Back button works occasionally as normal. Otherwise, it retabulates the search results in an odd order than what you were just previously viewing. It also takes you back to the top of the search results. If you're looking at 300+ listings (and one in particular), then hit the back button, be prepared to be rerouted to the top of the search results. It's happening multiple times and I've cleared my cache, reboot, etc. REALLY IRRITATING and time consuming.

I give up. I'm never selling on this app again. There are too many hidden costs. Old: It was getting a bit better, but there's still a lot of bugs. Also, the "watched item" reminders can't be individually turned off which is super frustrating and annoying. I get random notifications daily! I've had to just turn off all notifications instead.

I love ebay for most of my shopping needs. Whatever amazon doesnt have ebay most definately does. Especially when it comes to car and motorcycle parts. The only issue I have is with the layout of your app. When I am looking through listings, the palm of my right hand (lowest part of my thumb) accidentally hits the selling section of the bottom menu. And when i click back on the listings category it takes me to the home page. As far as i know there is no way to relocate this menu bar either. ☹️

Very Easy to do, almost as easy as the website. Edit: I get tired of going to do search all items at seller's stores, only for it to cycle through the same five to ten items several times before it moves on to another five to ten items to cycle through. Show each item once and once only. Don't keep showing the same items over and over again. If I am interested, then I will act accordingly, otherwise I want to see what else the seller has.

"Over the past 13 years, I've dedicated myself to selling various items on eBay. However, recent experiences have left me disappointed and concerned. In several instances, I've faced the frustrating situation where customers returned incorrect or damaged items. One time, the product I sold was returned with entirely different contents, leading to a loss in both the case and my investment. Another instance involved a returned item with broken parts, and most disheartening was receiving wrong ite

Updated app and now is more annoying than before! Bottom menu is one issue. Options on edges (Home & Selling) accidentally get touched. This leaves search or whatever I was doing before. So annoying cause I HAVE to start all over! Sometimes more than once. There is still the issue with too many screens to get to where I want to. Just make it simple please! Like contacting seller. It takes me to some screen saying common questions. Also if item ends previous questions are gone.

This is one of the worst updates. Now you have a banner across the bottom of the screen, when it was perfectly fine the way it was!!!!!!!!! Updating things that are not broke or having problems is a HUGE waste, but they make you update the app to access some new tid bit that's not a help, so the IT people can get a pat on the back. USELESS UPDATE NOT NEEDED!!!!!!!

the sellers are wonderful. but the eBay app is terrible. when searching for a car part it throws all kinds of different vehicles parts at you. no matter how precise I am with descriptions, the app still shows so many other parts for different cars and different types of vehicles. when I scrolled down 2 or so pages I finally find what I was looking for. And don't even try ordering another part from the same seller. Cause you won't find anything else listed. app needs serious overhaul. wr

New to the app - only had it about 5 months. Can't stay off it. My only issue is, it appears, some sellers can combine shipping automatically while others cannot. I have to reach out to them directly - not sure why that is, but then I need my PC for that (as the option is not there for a smartphone). The same with other features such as "last sold" in "advanced search". Still very happy with the app nonetheless.

I use ebay almost more than Amazon. I love what they(the sellers) have to offer. The prices are always where I want them. Bad ecosystem l experiences are rare. They've cut out the scammers pretty well for the most part. For not doing their own warehousing, they keep together pretty fabulous. Kudos. App is the only way I use in terms of browser v app. I go to browser rarely if I can't find something. I wish there was a selection when searching to exclude items/brands from appearing in search.

Ever since the latest update (November 2023) my screen will freeze at times, and then closes out. The WORST is suddenly it isn't allowing to messages!!! When you hit send a large square appears with the wording ALERT Service is not available with a blue clickable ok in the righthand bottom corner. This is a HUGE PROBLEM for BOTH BUYERS AND SELLERS and NEEDS TO BE FIXED IMMEDIATELY!! Stop causing issues every single time you update the dang app!

As a seller, some items state that you're able to send offers to interested buyers. When I go to do so, an error message is displayed. This is very annoying, especially when I'm under the impression that I can send an offer. Sometimes, I go to an eBay fee and profit calculator to figure out a good offer price. I waste a few minutes doing so. Only to come back to eBay ready with a price, eBay states that I can't send an offer. What a waste of time!

Updated format.....the new layout is terrible and the app now forces you to add payment info when you submit an offer. eBay has change over the years but this is the worst layout. the interface is more difficult to use. To add to this, the new update is even worse. My partner no longer uses the app at all. With the bugs and problems, I have switched to the browser instead myself. It takes a couple of days for an item in the app to let me pay while showing it as sold when I accept and offer.

Overall I like this app. It's fairly intuitive. I can create basic listings, see my solds, check payments, search items, etc. I do wish I could fully access my seller's dashboard in the app. It's very frustrating that clicking the "selling" button in Chrome always puts me in the app where I can't access the information I want. If you don't want to/can't put that functionality in the app, then allow me to choose to access the information in a browser from my smart phone.

Been using it for a while. It's a little glitchy and can be difficult to navigate. Especially since there are two different tabs that say selling but each has a separate menu. And shipping is extremely difficult as it seems to block certain shipping options when you list certain items but then after buyer has paid you are suddenly allowed those options. NOTIFICATIONS ARE ALL OR NOTHING 😠😠😠😠

The biggest issue I have using eBay are the sellers. It seems like half the time the items they have for sale they actually don't have it's only after I wasted my time scrolling and then paying to find out later than ever actually had the item. Sometimes you can get a hold of the sellers other times there's no answer. And probably the worst thing is PayPal. I've made four different attempts to get an account set up and it's non-stop glitches to the point where I just threw in the towel.

From what was a decent app for a seller, eBay has chosen to modify the app until it is almost unworkable. First the app changed the custom SKU so sellers waste hours looking for a sold item in the wrong place. Then eBay chose to change the preference for printing postage labels without notice not once but twice. So it's gotten to be more trouble than it's worth since your shipping preference is not only changed, but you're locked out from changing it back to what you prefer.

Update: 10/27/2023 The Android App is full of glitches. It astounds me that a multi-billion dollar company releases such an unfinished product to the masses. All product searches refresh as soon as you look at one item in a search; effectively destoying the search function. When creating listings, items specifics reset. Image search does not function. If you happen to get lucky and results are returned, it errors out. Ebay IT motto: one step sideways three steps back.

New UI is terrible. All the buttons to navigate are supposed to be at the bottom, but sometimes they aren't there at all. You have to just keep navigating around or opening and closing the app and hope that the buttons show back up so you can use the app fully. They also like to pop up "how are we doing" questionnaires in the middle of me trying to use the app. How are you doing? Well, you wouldn't be getting this 1 star review if you had just let me use the app in peace instead of pestering me.

For an app of this age id expect much more. It lacks luster and intentionally makes it hard to see where items are being shipped from. This can lead to delays in getting the product as the best prices are usually from china but it takes over a month for shipping. The site is so full of vendors now, that finding the old actions is extremely dificult. Id say Wish is a better option for the same quality and pricing but with discounts for most of what on here.

The app is horrible and needs TONS of work! When trying to edit and write your description on your listing if you add bullet points and sentences the app automatically keeps moving down and assuming everything is bullets when you're trying to type a sentence. You have to individually highlight every word to make them bullets and hope that the page doesn't scroll down and mess up and assume your next sentence isn't a bullet point. Not to mention zero tools for listings optimization

Customer service is good. My only gripe with eBay that the fees are so high. Used to be around 8% then 10% now it's 12%. Hope this won't only increase every few years, it's getting ridiculous, especially when selling a higher value item. You lose a lot of money. Plus it forces you to sell it at a higher price. Yes they do offer 80% fees but not often. Maybe should implement a dynamic fee depending on the price. 10% fee for 100$. 7% for 200$, 5% 300$ and so on.

Convenience, easy to use. search, sort, filter and list functions are very well organized. I can switch to different countries and addreses easily. Would be better to track shipped items for every sold items. I suggest in watch list under active items to add category for international items, for example if I watch items same time from US and UK ebay.

I like the use AI to automatically fill the details when creating a new listing I really don't like that it's no longer possible to copy the title or description when viewing a item as I use this to checkout the item in Google and YouTube and it has already stopped me buying a couple of eurorack modules as I don't have a photographic memory and I'm definitely not going to write everything down just to have to type it all in again. Seriously considering leaving eBay

persistent bug where you can no longer view items you've already purchased. it attempts to load the item page and then just loads none of the item, item variations, description, seller name etc. and only loads the similar products/shops bit that's usually underneath. very frustrating as I often view previously purchased items as new variations are frequently added.

They need to employ someone to sort this app out. Every time they update it it becomes harder to use,less user friendly and more buggy. Now the item description is a pop up window instead of a full screen which is hard to read and scroll through. The fees are high too. Not sure what the future holds for eBay. There's a lot of similar sites arising with much cheaper fees and user friendly apps. Shame as eBay was ace in the past.

Useless garbage. Can't even pay for anything. Just tells me "eBay app keeps stopping". Fees are ridiculous. I have to log in 4 times to do anything. Once to see messages. Once to send a message. Once to see my purchased items and once to change a profile setting. Each time requires SMS PIN also. Absolutely legacy programmed trash. I'll avoid and use my regional classifieds. Much cheaper and better developed. Edit: They forcibly reset my password without permission! Madness!

The app is good. Except when I want to list an item for sale and I get to the international sending option. There is no possibility to choose which country you want to ship to. Only worldwide is available. No exceptions. It should be possible to manually select the countries and set an individual delivery fee for each. This should be made possible on your website as well by the way. The current layout for this is horrible. Just let me select a country and put a delivery price for it. Simple.

eBay is badly in need of a major overhaul. Whether on mobile or browser, the UI is a badly optimized, outdated mess that is off-putting to use. For such a behemoth of a company, it's embarrassing that to navigate eBay is not an enjoyable experience. Furthermore, selling is the wild west, full of scams and a lack of support when issues arise. But happy to take a massive chunk of your money for increasingly less value in return. I just avoid it now, sadly.

App generally easy to use, but there is now an ongoing issue where my sold items won't always load. (Just get an error message). Clearing cache occasionally works, but is random and frustrating and is happening on more than one device. eBay were contacted through the correct channels, but failed to respond. Further update, as of 19/03/24, the 'Leave Feedback' button has disappeared, so now impossible to leave feedback via the app! Genius...

Overall decent app and I enjoy the able to add extra lists but it now pops up saying I can't add more to my watch list even though that isn't full or give me the option to add it to my other lists plz fix . I literally can't add things to my watch list or lists has it constantly says there full even though there almost empty. Just allow us to have separate lists for our searches and each can have like 50 to 100 in each with saying full .

Generally easy to use, quite intuitive. Often very helpful in setting up the right sale, also excellent payment system. One point deduction because of unnecessary problems when trying to put in postage prices, auctions etc. The app would often change the postage to a higher amount and include an auction or lowest offer price without being required. Constant attention is needed to see that what you are selling matches up with reality!

Don't get me wrong I love ebay but the app now looks like a child designed it, everything is so big and bold (and blue), I also don't like the quick access bar at the bottom as you have less content on the screen and it's more distracting for some reason . Please make the app a bit more sophisticated or at very least give us the option to revert back to a more traditional ebay look .

I've been on eBay for 16 years, my business is practically ran from eBay. Overnight they've completely ruined the user experience! It's now terrible. I don't know what the developers were on when they made the recent update. I can no longer access all the files on my phone when uploading photographs, I can no longer batch select photographs to be deleted, I can no longer quickly preview a picture on my listings by clicking it, I can no longer drag photos to rearrange them..it's rendered useless!

I'm not keen at all on constant change for change's sake. Titanic~deckchairs. I don't like menu along the bottom- too easy to hit accidentally, it worked well enough up the side. What happened to the useful copy tracking number icon? That lasted how long? a couple of months? Why can't you leave things alone when folks have got familiar with them. "Plus ça change; plus c'est la même chose."

I use Ebay A LOT. 1.2k items sold over the last 2 years and probably 10k in purchases. My warehouse flooded & FOUR orders over the last YEAR I cancelled because item was damaged. This put me at 'below standard' so they take ~20% instead of the normal ~13%. Since it's a new year my next review (happens once a month) I'll be a top seller again. But in the 1 month since that I lost around $200 in Dec xmas revenue. Customer service is HORRIBLE. For the $ I pay in fees its ridiculous. I could go on

Getting support from ebay has become a nightmare. It takes more than a month to get a refund when a buyer never ships your item and there is no way to talk to anyone about it. You just gotta keep giving a seller one week to reply every week until it turns into a month. Plus the fees now for selling are way too high.

STOP UPDATING THE APP, ITS USELESS. Useless app and becoming more and more difficult to use. Been an eBay user for 20 years and it's going downhill rapidly. All saved searches are now ruined, all set correctly but just showing international sellers. New menu function is a disgrace and developers clearly never tested before releasing. Moving the menus to the bottom, can't understand why? The side menu was much better and flowed alot easier while using the app. The current app is not recommended.

Why am I bombarded with offers on things I've only looked at, nothing in my watched list or cart and I get "Pay Now" notifications on things I've only looked at? I'm too scared to click on anything and looking at online posts, turning off notifications doesn't stop it from happening....not that I can find the Tab they're talking about. I've been an Ebayer for a long time but the way it's going I'll be uninstalling.

Why?? Latest update includes a 5-Item Icon list that runs horizontally across the bottom of the Screen : These functions already exist elsewhere on the App without having to "dig for them" anyway, so the only result in having a banner of duplicated icons along the bottom is to waste a whole bunch of space that now limits what's seen in the Search Results. Another example of programmers that develop apps but don't actually use it themselves.. Please omit, or allow option to hide the icon row.

The app is ok. Service is terrible. Too many frauds providing tracking info and then changing delivery address to somewhere else so that the item shows up as delivered. eBay hasn't picked up on this yet, or the fact that with shipping details you can see the weight and size of a package. Last I knew, a 6 gallon air compressor doesn't weigh 13 oz... I've also received washcloths in the shape of a bear instead of a bench grinder or vacuum... Def not what they once were

There is a serious omission in the design of this application. If you've chosen the app to act as the 2FA authenticator for a web browser login, when you need to log into the app itself, you can't. This is because the 2FA notification is sent to the app as usual, but you're unable to verify the access request because you can't leave the sign in page without having to start all over again. This is a huge oversight IMHO. The only way around this is to chose SMS or email confirmation instead.

Great to buy items but to sell something is annoying, the constant limits on the item being listed can only reach £10 maximum, then when you put an item up that's £5 still same thing. Very annoying not to be able to get an item on eBay but then send me emails for an invoice for the privilege is beyond me

I been using ebay for a long time for buying and selling, mostly for selling but I don't sell on it hardly anymore....fees are way too high and now they charge the sellers for shipping labels....sellers should not be charged to pay for a shipping labels to print out...Thats supposed to go towards the buyers. Just use mercari and postmark, they don't charge sellers for shipping labels.

I always find what I need. I collect cracker jack prizes, and I have been able to find a bunch of hard to find items. I do wish there was something that could be done with the automatic bidder apps! That some people use. That infuriates me. But other than I really enjoy shopping and buying on E-Bay!!!

For buying its okay as it stands but I regrettably sold something and was charged an extortionate amount after postage. They take a cut of the total sold which includes the postage. Absolutely disgraceful. I'll stick to vinted from now on, no hassle or hidden fees as a seller. Selling an item for just over £30 to pay nearly £5 in fees is not something I'll be doing again.

The whole eBay experience is getting tired. Listing is a pain, it constantly forgets the postage details you had when relisting, always wants to default to allowing offers, sets stupid prices for buy it now. They have 80% off seller fees promos but if the item relists and sells the next week the fees are ridiculous. Item sold for £30, the fees are nearly £5 or 16%, not including PayPal fees. Been using it for years but it's being over taken by other apps.

I swear this app gets worse every time they update it. Now doesn't load pictures in the order you select them (which it used to do), adding time to every listing as you rearrange them. Crashes or gives errors when listing much more regularly than ever before. Doesn't let you correct errors made by previous sellers without removing the EAN/ISBN.

Frustrating!!! The app on the whole is excellent until you want to revise your item for sale. You can revise everything apart from the auto accept value so you get to saving your changes and you get a message telling you to change your auto accept value, but you cannot! There is nowhere on the app to do this, so you end up going to the Chrome browser to do this, where it constantly tells you they have an app! Like I said, it's frustrating. Please add this feature to the app!

I like ebay. When I make an offer on something I would like to be able to retract the offer if I change my mind before the seller responds. Also when sellers have batteries for sale they should be required to list the expiration date. .please let me choose on each transaction weather or not ebay uses auto pay. Other than that I really like ebay. Thank you........ David

The app works well most of the time however I have encountered the occasional problem of it not accepting PayPal without rhyme nor reason. I end up having to wait up to two days before it accepts it at checkout which is a real problem for buy it nows (often lossing the product) and delays the settlement after actions. The problem occurs a few times a month.

First of all, was promised $5 off coupon on my next purchase for downloading the app, which I definitely did not receive on my next purchase. Secondly, the app is harder to navigate than the original web version. To go from browsing back to my watchlist takes longer and caused me to miss out on at least one item I was placing a last second bid on. Overall terrible experience using this app the last three days. If I could give zero stars I would, and will be deleting as soon as I post.

I've sold on eBay as individual for 20+years. We made eBay what it is. But since they've gone to small business model they've thrown individual sellers under the bus. I've been asked to pay 39% promo fee of $9.99 auction listing price for only 1 listing cycle, sell or not. & I just noticed on a search that if promo isn't purchased we get buried below "to get all results click here" so small most won't notice it. Today they changed shipping on sold auction to higher priced so I can't print label

Great for buying items never had issues there.. every item was received, account details never hacked, site is indeed secure. It's the selling I've found to be a bit more complex and by that I mean the payout process but then again it's not a source of income for me I'm just a casual seller. I honestly think the look of the site needs a makeover though..Very clunky, cluttered..not visually appealing compared to sites like amazon, etsy.. no offence but when did Ebay last updated their site/app?

Good resource for used and vintage goods, but could be better if made more friendly to multiple purchases from same seller that combine shipping expense. The current model is very much geared up for a single purchase and done, and some of the more recent changes with forcing an immediate payment on offers and such just reinforce that further, and make it extra cumbersome for buyers and sellers of multiple items in a single order. New/current items are very much hit or miss, in quality and value
